Hi,
Thanks for the reply.
This is requierd because our test suites are fairly
big. So I would not like to add a new test suite every
time.
The idea is to identify which new methods have been
added in a version.
(I have written a doclet which does this, how can i
integrate this doclet with junit)
Any idea.
Regards
Raman

--- Russell Gold <russgold@...> wrote:

> On Fri, 03 Dec 2004 11:01:18 -0000, ramandeep340
> <ramandeep340@...> wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > Hello,
> > 
> > I would like to know if there is a mechanism to
> segregate
> > test case results based on some version. e.g I
> have test
> > functions which were added in different versions
> of test
> > suite, can I segregate the results based on these
> versions.
> > 
> > I can identify the versions may be by adding a
> javadoc or
> > some kind of parsing. Personally, i am not infavor
> of parsing
> > technique.
> 
> If you really need a separation, you can always put
> new functions into
> separate suites. I have never seen the need. Why do
> you want to
> separate them?
>
